name: Introduction to American Politics
description: This course provides an overview of the major components of American politics, including the Constitution, the branches of government, political parties, interest groups, and elections.

name: Political Ideologies and American Politics
description: This course will examine the major ideologies of contemporary American politics, such as liberalism, conservatism, libertarianism, populism, and progressivism. It will also discuss the role of ideology in American politics and how ideologies shape political debates.

name: American Political Behavior
description: This course will explore the psychological and sociological factors that influence political behavior in the United States. Discussion topics will include public opinion, voting behavior, and political participation.

name: American Political Parties and Interest Groups
description: This course examines the role of political parties and interest groups in the American political system. It will discuss the structure and activities of political parties and interest groups, as well as their influence on the political process.

name: American Political Institutions
description: This course will explore the role of the major American political institutions, including the presidency, Congress, and the Supreme Court. It will examine the powers and responsibilities of each institution and how they interact with each other.
prerequisites: American Political Parties and Interest Groups

name: American Public Policy
description: This course provides an introduction to the study of public policy in the United States. It will explore the process by which public policies are formulated, implemented, and evaluated.
prerequisites: American Political Parties and Interest Groups

name: Contemporary American Politics
description: This course will focus on the current debates and issues in American politics. It will explore how the political process is shaped by a variety of factors, including public opinion, political parties, interest groups, the media, and the economy.
prerequisites: American Political Parties and Interest Groups
